entry.title: Integration Advisor ‚Äì Download MAG Simulation Result as EDI Payload
entry.content:
In this blog post I would like to share with you a small new feature we have delivered: When downloading the result of a Mapping Guideline (MAG) simulation you have now the additional option to get the payload in EDI format. 

Recap: Using Source EDI Payloads in Integration Advisor

Last year we added direct support for EDI payloads in the Integration Advisor capability of SAP Integration Suite.

In Integration Advisor, there are multiple places where you can make use of your existing payload data:

  • Create a Message Implementation Guideline (MIG) based on a payload
  • Simulate a Message Implementation Guideline (MIG)
  • Simulate a Mapping Guideline (MAG)

If your source payload is a text-based (flat-file) EDI message (from B2B Standards like ASC X12, UN/EDIFACT and its subsets, Odette or TRADACOMS), you can use the EDI payload directly as input for these features.

More details can be found in this previous blog post: Link

Download MAG Simulation Result as EDI Payload

So far, EDI support has been limited to source payloads. From the SAP Customer Influence program we have learned that a similar feature would also be interesting for the target payload (see here for more details: Link). 

After executing a MAG Simulation, you have the option to download the target payload which was the result of the simulation. For this you can use the Download button - refer above screenshot for MAG Simulation. If your Target MIG represents an EDI message, then you have now the additional option to download the result in EDI format. See screenshot below for the downloaded file of our example. 

Conclusion

This blog post explains our new feature to download a MAG simulation result as an EDI payload. This will help you to work even more efficiently with Integration Advisor if you want to compare the simulation result with an existing expected target EDI payload. 

(Note: This feature will become available with the August update of SAP Integration Suite which is currently rolled out to all data centers.)

Further reading

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/integration-advisor-direct-support-of-edi-payloads/ba-p/13779418 

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/integration-advisor-overview-of-components-for-... 

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/simulating-mapping-guideline

entry.title: Re: Issue with Form Language in Billing Document Output I...
entry.content:
Hello @Ayman101,

I see that on your parameter 'OUTPUT', the first line has the value =" ". This condition compares if the value of the field 'OUTPUT' is equal to a space. This would result in bellow cases:

  • OUTPUT =  "" (blank) > false.
  • OUTPUT = " " > true.
  • OUTPUT = "test" > false
  • OUTPUT = true > false
  • OUTPUT = 1 > false.

Make sure this filter is set up correctly because it might be giving you the wrong determinations. If you don't want to filter by anything on the 'OUTPUT' field, just clear the value instead of setting a space. Since this line might not determine the language if the condition is false, the system can get the language from other place, such as the business partner language,

Kind regards,
Luiza

entry.title: Managing Themes Across SAP Environments
entry.content:
In this blog post, I‚Äôll share best practices for managing themes created with the UI theme designer across multiple SAP environments. This guide is especially relevant if you run applications on more than one SAP platform.

Theming Scenarios Covered

  • SAP Build Work Zone Theming:
    Integrating applications into SAP Build Work Zone and leveraging its theming capabilities.
  • Local Theming:
    Using the UI theme designer installed in a specific environment. Themes are distributed via export, import, and transport mechanisms.
  • Remote Theming:
    Using the UI theme designer from SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, and accessing theme CSS remotely.

UI Theme Designer Availability

  • SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment:
    Always provides the latest version of the UI theme designer.
  • SAP BTP, Neo environment:
    In maintenance mode (version 1.75). Receives patches and bug fixes, but not new features.
  • SAP S/4HANA:
    The available UI theme designer version depends on your S/4HANA release. See SAP Note 1852401 for details.
  • SAP NetWeaver Portal:
    In maintenance mode (up to version 1.60). Included in UISAPUI5JAVASCA. See SAP Note 3414472 for more information.
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud:
    Use the UI theme designer from SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment. For logo customization only, use SAP Fiori Launchpad settings.

Key Differences

  • ABAP Platform & SAP NetWeaver Portal:
    Custom theme CSS is stored in the platform. After updating UI technology or theming content, you must rebuild and republish themes for compatibility.
  • SAP BTP (Cloud Foundry & Neo):
    The theming service compiles theme CSS on demand for the requested UI technology version. No manual action is needed when UI technology versions are updated.

For more details on theming capabilities in specific environments, see SAP Note 1852400.

Let‚Äôs now explore each scenario in detail.

SAP Build Work Zone Theming

SAP Build Work Zone allows you to integrate applications from various environments into a single site. By applying a theme to your SAP Build Work Zone site, all integrated applications can inherit this theme, ensuring a consistent user experience across platforms‚Äîwithout the need to implement the theme separately in each environment.

An additional benefit is that the UI theme designer in SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment compiles the CSS for the specific UI technology version on demand, so you don‚Äôt need to manage theming for different UI technology versions manually.

Example: A SAP Build Work Zone site integrating an S/4HANA on-premise application.

If your theme is based on a modern SAP theme (such as Horizon) that isn‚Äôt supported by the UI technology version in your integrated system, you can define a fallback theme. To do this, open the UI theme designer, edit your main theme, go to the theme menu, select ‚ÄúProperties‚Äù, and add a fallback theme in the properties dialog.

For more information, see:

  • SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, Theming and Branding
  • SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, Theming and Branding
  • S/4HANA: Running a Custom Theme via a URL Parameter
  • SAP BTP: Running a Custom Theme via a URL Parameter
  • SAPUI5 SAP Theme Support
  • Unified Rendering SAP Theme Support

Local Theming

If your system includes the UI theme designer, you can manage themes locally and assign them to applications within that system. The theme format is consistent across different versions of the UI theme designer, allowing you to export and import themes as needed. Note that in some environments, you must compile a theme before it can be assigned to applications.

Many platforms also support transporting themes within the same environment. For example, you can transport a theme from a development system to a test system, and then to a production system. The following platforms support theme transport:

  • S/4HANA on-premise
  • SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment

A key challenge with this approach is maintaining version consistency across all systems. It‚Äôs recommended to designate one main system for editing your theme and distribute it from there‚Äîideally, the system with the latest version of the UI theme designer. If you use SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, it‚Äôs best to manage and edit your themes there to take advantage of the newest features.

For more information, see:

  • S4HANA: Transporting Themes Between Systems
  • SAP BTP: Transporting Themes Between Systems
  • Exporting Themes
  • Importing Themes

Remote Theming

You can integrate the UI theme designer from SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, with your S/4HANA Cloud systems to theme the SAP Fiori Launchpad and applications.

To do this, configure the remote connection using communication arrangement SAP_COM_0623. This setup allows you to create themes in SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, and apply them directly in your S/4HANA Cloud system.

For more information, see:

  • Integrating UI Theme Designer

Conclusion

The SAP Build Work Zone theming scenario requires the least effort, as you maintain a central theme that is automatically applied across all integrated systems. However, local and remote theming are also viable options. If you choose these approaches, it‚Äôs important to decide on a primary system for theme management and plan your theme distribution strategy to ensure consistency across environments.

We encourage you to ask questions and share your experiences with managing themes across SAP environments in the comments section. We look forward to hearing from you!

entry.title: Error M7053 - Posting period in goods movement
entry.content:
If you find the error M7053 as shown in the image below:

You can try to follow the steps:

First of all, it‚Äôs important to mention that we tried to post goods in 08/2025, but my posting period ended in 06/2025. Therefore, we first need to check and close the period for 07/2025, and only then will we be able to verify the latest period ‚Äî 08/2025.

1. Go to the app "Close Periods":

2. Fill the company code, the period - with the month (e.g. 07/2025) following the last posting period (e.g 06/2025) - and fiscal year boxe. Then select "Check and close periods": 

If you fill the period with the current month, like 08/2025 in this example, you are going to see the log below: 

3. So, after you close the period for 07/2025, you can repeat the same steps for the current month. After that, you should be able to perform postings goods in the current period.

entry.title: Re: cannot access public cloud
entry.content:
Hello @OmarEmbaby 

The error seems to be related to Single Sign‚ÄëOn (SSO) via SAML. Since it works on other laptops but not on yours, it is likely caused by something in your local environment rather than a pure system issue.

To resolve that error, I suggest you do the following:

  • First, clear your browser cache or cookies for your SAP domains.
  • Then, consider trying incognito or private mode or a different browser.
  • Next step will be to Verify your laptop‚Äôs date and time is correct.
  • Thereafter, temporarily disable browser extensions.
  • Please also check if VPN, proxy, or firewall is blocking SAML requests.
  • Finally, you should fully log out from all SAP sessions before retrying.

If these steps do not resolve it, involve your organization's IT to review your laptop‚Äôs security or network policies.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Manage Workflow for Supplier Invoice ‚Äì Authorization...

This issue could be due to

So what you can do is check Agent Determination in Workflow Step. Verify user authorization for role with workflow task processing. If I am correct, the authorization object is B_BUPA_RLT.  Confirm with your Security team.

Also check this SAP Help on How to Configure Flexible Workflow

entry.title: Re: Bex filter info Object search by text fails
entry.content:
Hi @solman_solman2 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Please note that during testing of the BW query using the InfoObject, you have the option to filter successfully by key but not by text. Even when you check the hierarchy text table it shows the same behaviour.

Based on the details you provided, I suggest you consider the following:

  1. You should check and ensure InfoObject text assignments in RSA1 --> InfoObject --> Text tab.
  2. Make sure you verify text records exist in the correct table and are loaded.
  3. Ensure your query includes required text joins or necessary attributes.
  4. Also confirm whether filtering is applied on hierarchy text or characteristic text.
  5. Test the search in another front‚Äëend tool. An example is Analysis for Office.

These checks should help you pinpoint why your text‚Äëbased filtering fails while the key‚Äëbased filtering works.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to Transport SAC Models and Import Jobs between Tenants without including the Source Connection
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are performing a migration between SAC tenants.
One tenant is QAS, where the data models are connected to an S4 QAS system, and the other tenant is PRD, where the migrated data models should connect to the S4 PRD system.

The client‚Äôs requirement is that in SAC QAS there should only be the S4 QAS connection, and in SAC PRD there should only be the S4 PRD connection.

At the moment, the only working method we found to migrate the models, while keeping their Import Jobs and transformations, is:

  1. Export the model with the source connection from QAS.

  2. Import it into PRD.

  3. Replace the data source in the Import Job with the PRD connection.

  4. Delete the QAS connection imported into PRD.

We are looking for a more efficient approach.

Is there a way to:

  • Redirect the connection during export/import, or

  • Transport Import Jobs (including transformations) without having to export the QAS connection?

Regarding this second point, we found old notes mentioning an object called ‚ÄúWrangler‚Äù that would migrate transformations, but we cannot find this object anymore.
Reference: SAP Community discussion on "Wrangler" object. 

Any guidance or updated best practice would be appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: The Data Service Request is required to be conditional. Try using the "If-Match" headernull
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to update a Custom Field of a Billing Document (aka customer invoice) on Public Cloud from SAP Integration Suite.

SAP provides 2 different APIs for Billing Documents:
ODATA V2: https://api.sap.com/api/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/overview
ODATA V4: https://api.sap.com/api/sap-s4-CE_BILLINGDOCUMENT_0001-v1/overview

Unlike for Sales Orders, where the V2 can be used for PATCH calls, for Billing Documents, only the ODATA V4 has the option to PATCH the object.
However, when I try using the ODATA V4 adaptor in Integration Suite, it gives the following error:
"The Data Service Request is required to be conditional. Try using the "If-Match" headernull [HTTP/1.1 428 Precondition Required]."

My steps are: 

Request Reply: ODATA V4 - a simple GET call to retrieve the E-tag in the header for the given Billing Docuement
Content Modifier: Create Body and Add "If-Match" on the Header from the E-tag
Request Reply: ODATA V4 - PATCH to update a custom field

But the PATCH call fails:

I have also tried to set the "If-Match" to *, but I get the same error.

The same steps for the Sales Order ODATA V2 is working, but I the Billing Document ODATA V4 gives me the above error.

Am I missing something, or am I doing something wrong?
Or is the ODATA V4 adaptor broken?

Any tips would be appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

I was trying to create a destination and send the notification using action from Marketplace called "HTTP destination request". entry.title: Re: Call Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application us...
entry.content: The "SF user id" is the id by which users are identified inside successfactors. Like 'sfadmin' for an admin user. It could be email addresses or firstlastname usernames, ... Whatever it is, that value has to be available somewhere in the IAS profile in a chosen field, and this field (e.g. "login name" or "custom attribute 1") has to be added into the IAS Assertion Attributes to be included in the JWT. Then in the Destination set userIdSource to the path in the token where to find it. See also: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/configure-user-attributes-sent-to-application

entry.title: Re: Investment indicator
entry.content:
Hello @jantoniomoyano3 

For SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the Investment Indicator is a country-specific field primarily relevant in localisations such as France, where it triggers specific tax or reporting procedures for capital investment transactions.

In Spain, this indicator is inactive and does not affect standard financial processing or legal reporting. Therefore, selecting it in the Create Incoming Invoices (FB60) app results in no change in posting behaviour or subsequent processes.

You can confirm this by reviewing the Spanish localisation scope in the SAP Help Portal and Feature Scope Description. There is no mapping or specific logic associated with the investment indicator for Spain. It will merely stay an unused field unless it is explicitly repurposed in a custom extension.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: üî¥ IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)
entry.content:
Developers often face challenges understanding the IT system landscape: What systems exist, what services do they offer, and how can they be integrated? Open Resource Discovery (ORD) addresses this issue by providing an open-source standard for decentralized system descriptions. ORD details available APIs, events, data products, and AI resources, along with their contracts and documentation.

In this talk, we will explain what ORD is, the problems it solves, and why we created it. We will also discuss how SAP leverages ORD to publish a static catalog of offerings, enable real-time landscape introspection, and support products like SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Business Data Cloud, and SAP Build.

Additionally, we will present how we have built an ecosystem to simplify ORD adoption, helping developers identify issues earlier and improve the quality of metadata and documentation over time for both SAP and our customers.

Finally, we will share our current thinking on how ORD can benefit the AI ecosystem.

entry.title: Instance Sharing - SAP Cloud Logging
entry.content:
Co-Authored by: @wolfgang_theilmann and @Benny-Goerzig 

Centralizing observability data offers significant advantages by providing a unified view across different organizations, spaces, sub-accounts, and even regions.

SAP Cloud Logging provides the ability to "share" a single instance across various application deployment locations. This offers two key benefits:

  • It simplifies the centralization of observability data into a single or fewer instances.
  • It drastically reduces costs compared to Application Logging, where customers must create a separate instance for each space.

This document outlines different contexts, tools, options, and best practices for instance sharing

Understanding scopes of sharing and tools

Sharing an instance basically involves either creating a new instance or reusing an existing one at a specific location and making it (credentials) available to multiple applications, spaces or other locations, without having to create a duplicate instance.

There are two primary methods of instance sharing:

Built-in / native sharing

In this approach, the runtime environment (such as Cloud Foundry) or platform (such as BTP) provides APIs to facilitate sharing.

  • Advantages:
    • Credentials are transparently transferred to the destination.
    • The system manages authorization, determining who can share or modify the parent instance.
    • The lifecycle of the parent and shared instance are closely aligned
  • Disadvantages:
    • This method limits shareability to a narrower location scope, such as within a single subaccount.

Documentation: CF docs on sharing-instance

Sharing by reusing credentials

Cloud Logging service offers global endpoints ‚Äì which makes its APIs accessible from anywhere. So, create service key from an existing instance which can be used to create new  and consumed by applications from other location. Cloud Foundry offers ‚ÄúUser Provided Service‚Äù to achieve this.

    • Advantages:
      • Universal applicability across regions, subaccounts, and environments.
    • Disadvantages:
      • Maintenance considerations, including credential transport and rotation, can be additional effort.

Documentation: User-Provided service instances

Locations of instance sharing

In BTP, instance sharing can happen between different source and destination locations. For this guide, we‚Äôll zoom in on the Cloud Foundry runtime and walk through all the possible ways you can share an instance within it.

Cloud Foundry (CF) runtime

In CF environment, instance sharing can occur in the following scenarios

Same CF API endpoints:

CF spaces in the same org

  • Example: Space-A ‚áÜ Space-B within Org-X

CF spaces in different subaccounts on the same main/extension landscape and region

  • Example: Space-A in EU10-004 (SubAccount-X) ‚áÜ Space-B in EU10-004 (SubAccount-Y)
Different CF API endpoints:

CF Spaces across different subaccounts on different hyperscaler

  • Example: Space-A in EU10 (SubAccount-X) ‚áÜ Space-B in EU30 (SubAccount-Y)

CF Spaces across different subaccounts on different main/extension landscape

  • Example: Space-A in US10 (SubAccount-X) ‚áÜ Space-B in US10-002 (SubAccount-Y)

CF Spaces across different subaccounts in different regions

  • Example: Space-A in US10 (SubAccount-X) ‚áÜ Space-B in EU10

Sharing using CF CLI

Sharing a Cloud Logging instance using CF API, where possible, is straightforward.

cf share-service SERVICE-INSTANCE -s OTHER-SPACE

then proceed with binding it to CF apps from the OTHER-SPACE.

Please read the limitations and security considerations from CF docs on sharing-instance

Sharing using User-Provided Service (UPS)

Best Practices
  1. Name Service Keys Clearly
    • Consider using one service key per remote CF location where the instance will be shared.
    • Include the remote CF location identifier in the service key name for easy association with its target destination.
  2.  Rotate Service Keys Periodically
    • Either based on your organisation‚Äôs compliance policy or if you mTLS, then based on the cert validity, you might have to periodically update the User Provided service
    • Rotation involves creating a new service key in the parent instance and updating the UPS in the target locations accordingly.
Sample Script

Below is a sample script demonstrating how to share and update an instance using a User-Provided Service (UPS).

In this example, we create a central SAP Cloud Logging instance in EU10 (referred to as the Source CF location) and make it available in other location - EU30 (referred to as the Destination CF location) by sharing it through a User-Provided Service.

  • Create & bind to UPS:  See attachment below create-UPS.txt üìé
  • Update UPS: See attachment below update-UPS.txt üìé

Visualizing

Using OpenSearch Dashboards, telemetry data (CF logs & CF Container metrics) from all the bound apps can be viewed centrally from the parent instance.

You can distinguish and filter for different locations based on fields like `organization_name` and `organization_id`

Considerations & Tradeoffs

Planning actual instantiation and deployment of Cloud Logging service instances should consider the following aspects:

  • Cost: in most cases shared instances should be more cost effective than dedicated ones.
  • Legal/Operational aspects might enforce customers to run dedicated instances. Still Cloud Logging provides many security-level features (e.g. index-level security) which might be sufficient to satisfy those.
  • Analytics: putting observability data into a shared instances allows for combined analysis. Note: in contrast to Application Logging, data cannot be analyzed across service instances.
  • Ingestion throughput: Remote ingestion (from Cloud Foundry) may come with bit lower throughput especially if you connect regions that far away physically.

entry.title: Re: SAP S4 HANA Cloud - oAuth 2.0 with Scopes
entry.content:
Hello @Simon 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the outbound OAuth 2.0 configured in a Communication System supports the client-credentials grant with Audience/Resource, but it does not expose a field for OAuth scopes. That‚Äôs why you don‚Äôt see it in the UI.

Use the Azure AD v1 token endpoint (resource-based)

    •  Token endpoint: https://login.microsoftonline.com/<tenant>/oauth2/token (v1)
    •  Use your API‚Äôs Application ID URI as the Audience in S/4HANA Cloud.
    • With v1, Azure requires a resource (not a scope), which matches S/4HANA Cloud‚Äôs Audience field.
    • Grant your calling app Application permissions for that API and consent to them in Azure AD.
    • This removes the need to send the scope.

If you must use v2 (scope-based)

    •  Azure v2 expects scope=api://<app-id>/.default for client-credentials.
    • ‚ó¶ The Communication System UI cannot send scope, so use SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) or SAP BTP Destinations, where you can configure OAuth2 client-credentials and explicitly set the scope, then call Power Platform from there.

Why FB60-type fields are not useful in this context. The Outbound OAuth 2.0 block you showed (Authorisation Endpoint, Token Endpoint, Audience, mTLS Endpoint) is the complete set for S/4HANA Cloud direct outbound. There is no hidden switch for scopes at present.

Practical setup (recommended approach)

  •  Prefer Azure v1 token endpoint plus Audience (resource) in S/4HANA Cloud, or
  •  Insert SAP Cloud Integration in the middle if your security team mandates v2 plus scopes.

Check the documentation below

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/v2-oauth2-client-creds-grant-flow

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/v2-overview

Configuring the OAuth 2.0 Client-SAP Help 

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Outbound Delivery Date
entry.content:
To answer your first question, SAP creates outbound deliveries based on the confirmed delivery date in the sales order, which is typically determined by the ATP check at order entry. Even if stock becomes available earlier from a different PO (like PO 3850), SAP does not automatically reschedule the delivery date unless:

  • You manually change the delivery date
  • You re-run ATP or delivery scheduling
  • You implement custom logic to override the original date

So, even though stock was available on 04/06/2025, the system retained the original confirmed date of 01/07/2025 from PO 4627 because that was the date promised to the customer and used for scheduling.

To answer your second question, in standard SAP behavior, Delivery creation is triggered by stock availability, but Delivery dates are not automatically recalculated based on that availability unless explicitly configured

This means the system creates the delivery when stock is available, but it does not override the original delivery date. This is to preserve the customer commitment and avoid unintended early shipments

If your business wants deliveries to reflect actual stock availability, you‚Äôll need to enable dynamic delivery scheduling or use a custom enhancement (e.g., in delivery creation logic or via BAdI) to update the delivery date to the current date when stock is available

entry.title: Work Zone: text widgets in a single row, height no longer aligns
entry.content:
Work Zone has once again unilaterally changed the way it behaves with the result of messing up my design.

Until this morning (13 Aug 25) when adding text widgets to a single row (a freestyle section with multiple columns), text widgets were presented as the same height, regardless of how much text was in each.

See example, below: each of the three elements has a different amount of text (2 lines, 3 lines, 1 line), but the white boxes all displayed with the same height as the largest box.

Perfect - a nice balanced design.

Now here's what it looks like:

The text widget height is controlled by the amount of text in each widget. My design looks like a row of wonky teeth. Thanks SAP.

So what has happened and why? When are we going to get consulted or at the very least notified in advance of these sorts of changes? See my other posts for other rants about SAP changing the front end unilaterally. 

Honestly SAP, you are consistently disappointing. If you expect us to promote your product in any way you need to get better at this.

entry.title: Re: How to Set Up Automatic Login in SAP
entry.content:
Hi @Aprendiz_Tecnologia 

Thank you for your question. Let us look at potential solutions.

There are a few options you can consider to enable you achieve the desired automation. You can either choose SAP Shortcut (sapshcut.exe), SAP GUI Scripting, Auto Logon File, Single Sign-On (this is most secure method) or third part tools.

However, I would recommend you prioritize use sapshcut.exe or GUI scripting, which provides you a quick local setup or you implement SSO for more security and compliance.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Advance Your Career as a Certified SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Project Manager
entry.content:
Around 60% of cloud buyers told IDC‚Äôs Cloud Pulse Survey in October 2024 that their business‚Äô IT or digital infrastructure currently requires major transformation, and 82% said their cloud also requires modernization. In response to these pressing industry needs, effective project management has become essential, particularly for navigating complex cloud-based initiatives. The new certification for SAP Certified Associate - Managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Projects (C_S4PM2) provides a unique opportunity for professionals to become certified project managers, equipping them to lead transformative digital efforts with expertise and strategic insight. 

Designed for Project Managers, Consultants, and Technical Leads, this certification empowers you to excel in managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition implementations, positioning you to become a strategic leader in your organization's digital strategy, providing direction and specialist knowledge in project execution. 

How to prepare for this certification 

You can prepare for the exam in your own pace, by completing the "Managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Projects" learning journey, designed to provide comprehensive insight into SAP S/4HANA Cloud project management. With free access to the learning journey, you can deepen your expertise of managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition projects, spotlighting SAP tools and strategic implementation methodologies. Among these, the RISE with SAP Methodology stands out as a vital, holistic approach tailored for cloud transformation journeys. 

Additionally, SAP Community blog posts provide some supporting information to deepen your understanding and preparation: 

  • 12 Things that SAP implementation methodology SAP Activate tells you to do 
  • Planning your System Conversion to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition following SAP Activate 
  • SAP Activate for RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition now available by Deployment Journey 
  • Conversion Guide for SAP S/4HANA 2023 for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023
  • Review the SAP Activate Minute videos in this playlist. 

You can also explore more insights about SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition on SAP for Me, and take a look at the release notes.  

As a prerequisite, candidates should possess project management experience, preferably in ERP implementation, especially SAP Cloud-related projects. Additionally, hands-on experience with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition solutions, knowledge of SAP Cloud ALM, and experience managing cloud-based SAP projects are beneficial.

Get started today 

Achieving the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition certification allows you to become a crucial asset in driving your organization's growth and innovation. This certification validates your 

competency in integrating business goals with technical solutions, enhancing your leadership role in cloud project management.  

Certified learners must regularly update their skills and keep certifications valid by completing mandatory annual assessments before expiration. With an SAP Learning Hub subscription, you can take these assessments anytime during your certification's validity.  

Build the skills you need on the‚ÄØSAP Learning site‚ÄØand get inspired by reading learner stories on‚ÄØSAP Community, ask questions and connect with fellow learners. When you‚Äôre ready, take your certification exam and start shaping your industry's future!‚ÄØ

entry.title: Re: How to generate Payment advise if payment done by app...
entry.content:
Hello @gautam_SAP 

In the S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, Payment advice is automatically generated only when using Manage Automatic Payments.
For payments posted through Post Outgoing Payments, you must manually create the advice in Manage Payment Advices (type 04) and reference the journal entry.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: how can i restrict the equipment that can be seen by...
entry.content:
Hi @Hichem_Rahmani 

Thank you for your question. Note sure this request is still open on your side.

Following up on the issue you raised regarding the difference in behaviour, this appears to be due to different filtering logic in the two apps. To re-iterate the important details:

Find Technical Object applies stricter filtering based only on cost center, so objects with an empty cost center field are excluded.

Change Technical Object may retrieve the equipment via direct reference, bypassing the stricter cost center filter.

Here are steps I suggest you take to ensure the settings are correctly done:

First, verify the cost center restriction behaviour for empty fields in the ‚ÄúFind Technical Object‚Äù app.

Then check if the restriction can be adjusted to also consider WBS elements in equipment visibility.

Finally, review SAP Help or SAP Notes for known limitations in this area, and if needed, you can raise a ticket with SAP Support to confirm if this is expected behaviour or a defect. The link below will be helpful

 

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

https://help.sap.com/doc/7c9e0bbbd1664c2581b2038a1c7ae4b3/2508.500/en-US/FSD_CE2508.pdf

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/using-restrictions-to-enhance-user-authorizations-in-the-sap-s-4hana-cloud/ba-p/13575978

entry.title: How to monitor the HANA DB Encryption status for the databases configured on SAP Focused Run
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We would like to monitor the HANA DB Encryption status for the databases configured on FRUN.
Is there any way we can find this report/dashboard on FRUN?

Any dashboard available as part of Tactical/OCC/Operational dashboards?

Best regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to monitor the HANA DB Encryption status for the...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

In SAP Focused RUN, the HANA DB General Encryption Status information is collected exclusively in the Configuration & Security Analysis (CSA) application.
There is a CSA store called HANA Encryption (HDB_ENCRYPTION) that provides information regarding Backup, Log, and Persistence scopes.

If you want to monitor this information, you can create a CSA policy for it and even create a custom metric to monitor the results.

For more information regarding CSA policies and Custom Metric creation, please refer to the following documentation:

  • SAP Expert Portal - Configuration & Security Analysis
  • SAP Expert Portal - Syntax Rules and Policy Check Examples
  • SAP Expert Portal - Available CCDB Config Stores
  • KBA: 3197989 - How to use Configuration and Security Analytics in System Monitoring Alerting - SAP Focused RUN



Best regards,
Jessica
SAP Support

entry.title: Document Definition using Custom Schema in 'Define Compliance Reports' App
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

Our requirement is to tweak(add some Custom fields) in the SAP Shipped Compliance/Statutory Reporting for Italy Fixed Assets (IT_FXDAST_REG).

Our requirement is mainly to add Custom Fields in the Header part of the pdf document generated as per the Report Definition (in 'Define Statutory Reports' app) configured..

Below were the steps followed:

1.) Copied Standard Report Definition 'IT_FXDAST_REG' to a ZVersion.

2.) In the Copied Report Definition, we added a Custom 'Query Definition' with Data Source used as Table(in our example case ANKA). 

3.) Now in the 'Document Definition' step, 

3.a.) We first created a Custom Schema with ID 'YIT_FXDAST_REG_1'  by taking reference of Standard Schema ID 'IT_FXDAST_REG_7', we added 2 fields from ANKA Table ( which would be mapped to the the Query we defined in Step 2 above) in the Schema .xsd file and later Created Schema 'YIT_FXDAST_REG_1' using this .xsd file.

3.b) Did the Mapping also for the new fields and also the Original mapping for other existing fields I manually retained back (since when we upload a new Schema the existing mapping gets wiped off).

4.) Created a XML Interface based AdobeForm using this .xsd file and attached above.

Now the issue am facing here is, even though all the mapping I had cross checked for the existing values, its noted that only the top level hierarchy header fields are getting populated including the newly added custom fields and the Nested Deep entities like Total, Asset Item Totals etc are not getting filled. Because of this in the AdobeForm wherever those Items are bound its giving error, if I remove all those elements and keep only the Header field it works.

Note: Highlighted is the Custom Field we added.

I checked in SE38 Program 'SRF_GENERATE' and its observed that the deep entities are not getting filled in the xml generated.

Bad case example(generated using the Custom Schema ID)

Good case example(which got generated using the Standard Schema ID 'IT_FXDAST_REG_7')

I tried searching the SAP Forum and even the SAP repository, have cross checked the Mapping and Cardinality everything , no luck. Any guidance here is much appreciated.

Additional info:

Below screenshot shows the difference between the Original Schema and the Custom Schema I created:

Entities added:

Their Types:

 

Thanks,

Sijin
